body_content.explanation: to change a part of a musical instrument in order to make it play particular sounds, but not in the correct or usual way:
examples: The piano had been mistuned, so the first half of the concert was a disaster.
The (deliberately) mistuned violin added an interesting expressiveness.

body_content.explanation: If a radio, television, etc., is mistuned, it does not receive programmes clearly from a particular station. :
examples: The static from a mis-tuned radio has a fairly constant loudness.
